place.name: FACIT
place.gazetteerText: FACIT, a chapelry in Rochdale parish, Lancashire; constituted in 1867. It contains a village, with cotton-mills, a co-operative store, and a Wesleyan chapel. Pop., about 4, 000. The living is a vicarage. Value, £200. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
